name: Etrop Grange

reviews.text: We stayed here VERY VERY last minute on the 21st Dec 2007 on our way to New York. We booked with Peter at about 10pm, a true gentleman who said he would accommodate our family of four in one room and save us the cost of an extra room (which was £99). When we arrived at midnight our room was ready and waiting and I must say what a surprise. It was huge, a bedroom with a lounge which was very clean and perfect for a 1 night stopover. The 2 gentleman on reception were very polite, very helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them.We didn't eat here so I can't comment on the food.Although I have heard that it is very good especially for lunch.
reviews.title: last minute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Etrop Grange Manchester Aiport several weeks ago. Normally we would just stay at the Radisson on site, but it was full. The Etrop Grange is beautifully decorated like an English Manor house. Definitely not your run of the mill Airport Hotel. We booked late at night at the last minute. The staff provided complimentary shuttle service to the hotel and treated us wonderfully upon check in. The room they gave us was absolutely delightful! I found the price reasonable. Of course the British pound is very expensive for Americans, but they charged us 99 Pounds. The Radisson was twice that!. We had breakfast in a beautiful room the next morning - complimentary. Overall a great hotel and would go back anytime I am in the area.
reviews.title: Convenience to Airport only positive!
An Alternative at Manchester Airport
reviews.text: Needed a last minute room at Manchester Airport and stumbled across this hotel. Other airport hotels were either sold out or twice the price. The hotel is a couple minutes ride from the airport. The room was small and basic but pleasant. Attractively older building from the outside but the rooms must have very thin walls as it is extremely noticeable how much you can hear from other rooms. The hotel has a nice lounge with food available and also a higher priced restaurant. Plenty of parking was available. Free wireless internet was a nice surprise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked to ensure an easy transfer to the airport. Staff were very good and the transfers went very well. However there is no alla carte menu on Sunday night and the room we were allocated at the back of the hotel needed a cleaning, dust on the wallpaper, stains on the carpet, cobwebs, the bathroom was scruffy and without hot water in the morning and a broken tap, the aircon looked half installed but the bed was very good. The location in relation to the airport was as good as the staff but the facilities needed attention. Expensive for the standard of accommodation with limited access for this with mobilty needs.
reviews.title: Great staff shame about the facilities

likes.disliked: — Condition of rooms & Sunday restaurante service

reviews.text: We took two double rooms - one smoking, one non-smoking - for the night of Sat 22 Sep 2007 as we were delivering my American cousin to Manchester Airport right next door early in the morning. A delightful little place, no airplane noise at all, and we found all the staff polite and helpful. We had dinner – 3 courses, wine & liqueurs for £40 each – which was good quality also. We have stayed here before and would do so again.
reviews.title: Good quality at Etrop Grange
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: This was the second time I've used the hotel prior to flying from Manchester airport and I can honestly say things were just as good the second time round. Check in was efficient and the reception staff were very friendly. The rooms are very nice and roomy especially for the price I paid on both occasions. On my more recent visit we had lunch in the bar and the food was very good. I have stayed at a few airport hotels in Manchester and I have found this one to be most value for money, friendly and comfortable. Check out was a breeze. The airport is only a few minutes drive away and the free shuttle to the airport is both speedy and efficient. I wouldn't pay the prices of the Hilton when this hotel offers good service, clean nicely furnished rooms and a friendly atomsphere at a reasonable price.

The hotel was tastefully decorated and well maintained. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. Food was excellant and the staff all had pride in their jobs and where they worked. Highly recommend this hotel

description: Etrop Grange is a gracious Grade II listed Georgian Country House originally built in 1780 by school teacher William Moss and although located just a short distance from Manchester Airport, is anything but an airport hotel.Originally known as Moss House, the hotel was renamed Etrop Grange in 1984 by the owners after a local area called Etrop Green. Etrop Grange first opened for business in November 1985 as a fine dining restaurant on just the lower level and was slowly converted into a hotel over the next 13 years with a £3 million refurbishment. The Etrop Grange still retains it's Georgian charm with its stately facade matched by a luxurious interior of decadent chandeliers, heavy drapes and marble fireplaces.Due to modern intervention the hotel is now ideally located just two minutes from Manchester Airport and the M56, and is one of the few hotels in the area with no overhead aircraft noise making it an ideal hotel for business and leisure alike. Offering complimentary transfers to and from the airport and airport railway station (between 06:00 and 22:00), along with complimentary parking and WiFi for all guests, Etrop Grange is the perfect place to spend a relaxing day or night whatever the occasion.
